arguments.info: When true indicates this downtime is being actively applied
When true indicates this downtime is not being applied
Optionally specify an end date when this downtime should expire
An optional message to provide when creating the downtime, can include notification handles
When specified, this downtime will only apply to this monitor
A list of monitor tags (up to 25), i.e. tags that are applied directly to monitors to which the downtime applies
Optional recurring schedule for this downtime
specify the group scope to which this downtime applies. For everything use '*'
Specify when this downtime should start
The timezone for the downtime, default UTC

attributes.info: When true indicates this downtime is being actively applied
When true indicates this downtime is not being applied
Optionally specify an end date when this downtime should expire
An optional message to provide when creating the downtime, can include notification handles
When specified, this downtime will only apply to this monitor
A list of monitor tags (up to 25), i.e. tags that are applied directly to monitors to which the downtime applies
Optional recurring schedule for this downtime
specify the group scope to which this downtime applies. For everything use '*'
Specify when this downtime should start
The timezone for the downtime, default UTC

arguments.info: Height of the screenboard
Whether the screenboard is shared or not
A list of template variables for using Dashboard templating.

subblock.info: The default value for the template variable on dashboard load.
The name of the variable.

arguments.info: Name of the screenboard
A list of widget definitions.

subblock.info: One of: ['background', 'text']
One of: ['counts', 'list', 'countsAndList']
One of: ['cluster', 'check']
The height of the widget.
One of: ['small', 'large']
One of: ['center', 'zoom', 'fit']
For widgets of type 'free_text', the text to use.
One of: ['host', 'container']
A list of conditional formatting rules.
Custom color (e.g., #205081)
Comparator (<, >, etc)
Custom  background color (e.g., #205081)
The palette to use if this condition is met.
Value that is threshold for conditional format
The name of the widget.
The alignment of the widget's title.
The size of the widget's title.

The type of the widget. One of [ 'free_text', 'timeseries', 'query_value', 'toplist', 'change', 'event_timeline', 'event_stream', 'image', 'note', 'alert_graph', 'alert_value', 'iframe', 'check_status', 'trace_service', 'hostmap', 'manage_status', 'log_stream', 'uptime', 'process']
One of: ['timeseries', 'toplist']
The width of the widget.
The position of the widget on the x axis.
The position of the widget on the y axis.

arguments.info: A description of the dashboard's content.
A list of graph definitions.

subblock.info: Automatically scale graphs
Use a custom unit (like 'users')
Filter for events to be overlayed on the graph.
A list of groupings for hostmap type graphs.
Include hosts without metrics in hostmap graphs
Include ungrouped hosts in hostmap graphs
Type of nodes to show in hostmap graphs (either 'host' or 'container').
How many digits to show
Type of change for change graphs.
The time period to compare change against in change graphs.
A list of conditional formatting rules.
Comparator (<, >, etc)
Custom background color (e.g., #205081)
Custom foreground color (e.g., #59afe1)
The palette to use if this condition is met.
Value that is threshold for conditional format
If set to 'present', this will include the present values in change graphs.
Decides whether to represent increases as good or bad in change graphs.
The field a change graph will be ordered by.
Sort change graph in ascending or descending order.
A list of scope filters for hostmap type graphs.
How to align text
The name of the graph.
